overview: At the age of 16, Rob Forman was selected to join an engineering apprenticeship program for academically talented students with George Washington University and the Department of the Navy. While studying at University of Maryland, Rob interned and went on to work at the Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory doing software development for the Department of Defense. He later moved to Booz Allen Hamilton to contract at the National Security Agency, where he expanded his background in network and information systems security. It was information security that took him to PriceWaterhouseCoopers to be a part of a security services start-up within the partnership, which was later spun off as a private company, beTRUSTed, and eventually purchased by Verizon Business to form its Security Solutions group. Robâ€™s expertise is solving core business problems with creative and secure technology solutions.
